entry.title: Re: Derivation in COPA using BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST
entry.content: Set up derivation rules in COPA customizing. Call BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST with CO‚ÄëPA relevant account assignments. The system will then derive profitability characteristics automatically, just like in manual journal entry.

entry.title: Re: SAP Note Not Available for My System Version
entry.content:
For the notes 3700214, 3701949, and 3704495, the system must be at least SAP ECC 606, it means that the problem they fix doesn't exist in SAP ECC 605, so you should NOT apply these notes in any way.

If you feel there's a bug in SAP ECC 605 which is not fixed by any SAP note, open a case at SAP Support with the steps to reproduce the bug.

entry.title: Re: SAP Note Not Available for My System Version
entry.content: Instead of (manually) implementing codes corrections from a higher level in your system (at your own risk), you could raise a case with SAP support to have those corrections applied in ECC 605, but good luck as End of Mainstream Maintenance for Product Version EHP5 FOR SAP ERP 6.0 was 31.12.2025.

The client provided us with the logo, but it is not published on any public website. When I use the image link, SAP displays it correctly within the system, but the logo is not shown in the outgoing email. The HTML code I am using is the following:

<div style="float:left;width:25%">
<img style="width:50%" src="https://my418744.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/opu/odata/sap/APS_OM_LOGO_SRV/ImageSet(Name='YY1_LOGOBIOWASTE')/$value">
</div>

Does anyone know if there is a way to make the logo visible in the email even though it is not publicly available on the internet?

Thank you very much and kind regards.

entry.title: Re: Configuring Employer Compliance Task for WTPA Forms
entry.content:
Hello @Lucas_Elias , we're facing similar issue like @Akanksha. For some reason, WTPA is not assigned to Coordinator, or HR Manager. We tried what you proposed, it was promising, but it's not triggered and HR Manager or Coordinator doesn't see this task on their home page nor in TO DO panel.

  • In compliance setting we have 1 default record for Notice of Pay Rate - Wage Theft Prevention Act
  • Under "Select a responsible user to carry out the employer compliance task" we have coordinator
  • In Manage data, under ComplianceConfiguration we have:
    • Group ID - US_WTPA
    • Country - USA
    • Enabled - Yes
    • specialConfigEnabled - No
    • i9RemoteSubmissionEnabled - No
    • ruleToEnableEmployerComplianceTask - RUle which is assigning default configuration from Compliance Settings
    • ruleToDefineCorpRepForEmployerComplianceTask - Rule which is assigning exact person

When we followed what you wrote, we were able to get all points except 4.

For some reason it's not going to assigned employee (coordinator). Checked rule execution log and rule was triggered successfully. 

Do you have any ideas please? We tried to fully follow this article and also comments, but still no luck.

Thank you, Lukas.

entry.title: SAP CPI - RFC Receiver interface does not works with BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT
entry.content:
Hello All,

I am working on an RFC receiver interface in SAP Cloud Integration where I am calling BAPI in SAP to create Orders. And I need to use the BAPIs "BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT" to commit the transaction for creation of Orders in SAP or  "BAPI_TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK" to rollback in case of errors.
But even though I receive successful response during the BAPI call for Order creation, it seems like the COMMIT does not works. I searched on internet and I understood that this is most likely because of the two BAPI(creation and commit) calls are being made in different sessions. I need a little help to understand the possible options with RFC receiver adapter to handle this situation.
To add more about the scenario, the input to SAP CI might result in more than one different Orders and I need to COMMIT only after all these Orders are successful.
I have observed that the "Send Confirm Transaction" option in RFC adapter works, but it is committing individual Order creation, whereas I need to commit only after all Orders are successfully created otherwise "BAPI_TRANSACTION_ROLLBACK" should be triggered.
Any help will be appreciated. Thanks!

Regards,
Faisal

entry.title: How do we trigger a Success Alert.
entry.content:
Hi,

I am asking this question to see if someone has solved this issue before, i am trying to create an alert for a success Scenario with the below limitations. 

1. This is an existing Integration with multiple subflows, the Trigger Iflow has a Start message and End Message and this triggers several sub- Iflows which are all Start Event - followed by End Event. 

2. I am trying to use a generic email Iflow in a different package, I can call this from an exception using the process direct adapter and it works fine. 

3. The issue is how do i use this to trigger an alert on Success, i don't want to force an error with a groovy script on a success process to use the bypass to create an alert. 

4. As we cannot create a local Integration Process with a start message/end message so cannot call the alert process via a Process direct adapter. 

Any thoughts ?

Ravi Iyer

entry.title: Re: CI-DS webservice dataflow created from an xml map and...
entry.content:
Hello Roberto,

The XML map leading into a function call needs to match the request schema, as you have seen. Therefore you could feed the batches of request data and the row count into Transform1 instead of trying two inputs to the function call.

Best regards,
Jeff
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: How can I fetch user Default Values using an ABAP Res...
entry.content:
For anyone wondering, I had the same question today and hope my answer helps.

Most parameters are stored as GET/SET parameters and are retrieved through the FIN_USER_DEFAULTPARAMETER_SRV odata service.

HOWEVER, the rest is stored as FLP personalization data. Long story short, it's in the /UI2/ITEM table and if you filter it by cont_id = 'sap.ushell.UserDefaultParameter' you should see the values. Screenshot below as an example. 

The data is stored neatly in a json string. 

I would suggest writing a custom entity to read the data in the table above along with the GET/SET parameters. It'll help in the long run to tie things in neatly. For the SET/GET parameters go through the DEFAULTPARAMETER_GET_ENTITY method of CL_FIN_USER_DEFAULTPAR_DPC_EXT class.

Hope it helps!

entry.title: Re: Research: Unmanaged Transactional Buffer For RESTful Application Programming Model
entry.content:
Hello Dmitrii, you make an absolutely valid point. Thank you for that.
You are correct that there is no necessity for double buffering if your API already handles it naturally. Moreover, it is best to avoid an unmanaged implementation whenever you can reduce complexity by using the managed type; otherwise, you risk significant boilerplate work for CRUD operations.
However, this approach is valuable when you need to provide transactional behavior to a data source that lacks it, especially when that source is complex (beyond database tables scenario, e.g involve requests to external service via http and etc.). The unmanaged implementation is quite opinionated. It doesn't offer a one-size-fits-all solution, but rather gives the developer the flexibility to design a buffer that fits their specific technical constraints.
Furthermore, this example serves as a great educational tool for developers to explore exactly how the unmanaged implementation works and how it differs from the managed one.

entry.title: Re: Research: Unmanaged Transactional Buffer For RESTful Application Programming Model
entry.content: Hello Jelena, thank you for such a warm response! I will definitely try to keep up the quality and consistency in my future posts.

entry.title: Re: CI-DS Agent version and Server version
entry.content:
Hello Bhanu,

With regards to the certificate update, you can focus entirely on the agent version and disregard the server version. Any of the agent versions available on Software Center will work with the current CI-DS server version.

Referring to the Agent Guide, see that there are currently only two agent versions currently recommended and >= 2509. Either agent version 2509 or version 2511 would be a good target for your upgrade.

Best regards,
Jeff
SAP Support

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA 2025: Key Innovations in Sales for the Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
üåü SAP S/4HANA 2025 Key Innovations in Sales for cloud Private Edition

With the October 2025 release of SAP S/4HANA 2025 Cloud Private Edition, SAP continues to strengthen the Sales line of business through new capabilities that improve performance, automation, and process transparency.
After exploring the latest updates, I‚Äôve summarized some of the highlights that deliver the most value‚Äîspanning Output Management, extensibility, order processing, returns management, and more.

üîéHow to Explore What‚Äôs New in SAP S/4HANA Releases

If you want to compare innovations between releases‚Äîfor example, from S/4HANA 2023 ‚Üí S/4HANA 2025‚Äîthe SAP Help Portal and the What's New Viewer remain the most efficient way to explore updates by product, line of business, and topic.

üëâYou can access the What's New Viewer What's New Viewer - SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition directly from the SAP Help Portal and filter by:

  • Product: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Line of Business: Sales
  • Type: New or Changed
  • Version range: From your current release to a target release

This allows you to quickly identify innovations relevant to your business processes.

Key Sales Innovations in SAP S/4HANA 2025

‚òòÔ∏è Output Management Enhancements (NAST + Output Control)

One of the major improvements in S/4HANA 2025 is SAP‚Äôs expanded support for Output Control in combination with legacy NAST‚Äëgenerated forms.

Preview NAST Forms in Fiori Apps

If you previously used NAST forms and later activated Output Management, you can now preview these legacy forms directly in Fiori, including:

üëâ  Manage Billing Documents: Document Preview (F0797)

üëâ  Manage Sales Orders Version 2: Document Preview (F3893) 

No additional configuration is required‚Äîyour existing NAST setup simply needs to remain active.

Here an example:

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide->Cross-Application Components->Output Control->Manage Application Object Type Activation

In Manage Sales Order ‚Äì Version 2 ( F3693 ) with a sales order that the form was generated by NAST:

You can preview the form: 

üí°Business Value: More flexibility to Customer outputs forms.

 

‚òòÔ∏è New Flexibility for Global Trade Management

In Trading Contracts, you can now choose between:

üëâNAST

üëâSAP S/4HANA Output Control 

üëâOr both, at the contract type level

This gives organizations more flexibility during transitions between output frameworks.

New Output Management for Global Trade Management

By default, the message determination for trading contracts is still NAST so if you decide to use Output Control you should configure first the object type activation for:

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide->Cross-Application Components->Output Control->Manage Application Object Type Activation

And then you can choose by Trading Contract type which Output Control indicator prefer:

SAP Customizing Impl. Guide->Logistics ‚Äì General->Global Trade Management->Trading Contract->Define Trading Contract Types

üí°Business Value: More features for Trading Contracts.

 

‚òòÔ∏è Import Sales Orders: Reference-Based Creation

A highly valuable enhancement: You can now create sales orders with reference to quotations or contracts using the Import Sales Orders app 

The imported spreadsheet now supports:

üëâHeader reference data

üëâItem reference data

üëâFull or partial carry-over of preceding document information

The new template include:

üí°Business Value: This reduces manual effort, improves data consistency, and accelerates end-to-end sales order creation.

 

‚òòÔ∏è New Extensibility: Sales Order API (A2X, OData V4)

SAP delivers a modernized and more efficient API Sales Order (A2X, OData V4) |built on the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP). It offers:

üëâFaster processing performance

üëâAsynchronous execution

üëâAbility to return minimal or full responses

üëâFull access to pricing details, including subtotals

üëâEnhanced filtering for sub-entities (items, partners, values, etc.)

This empowers developers to create more scalable and performant integrations.

To explore available APIs please follow this link: SAP Business Accelerator Hub

üí°Business Value: Improves process performance

 

‚òòÔ∏è New CDS Views for Global Trade Management

S/4HANA 2025 introduces additional CDS Views for GTM supporting:

üëâCustomer and supplier confirmation emails

üëâHeader-level contract information

üëâOutput parameter determination

üëâValue helps (organizational data, user IDs, contract types, etc.)

üí°Business Value: These new views help streamline reporting, automation, and custom extensions. For more information, please see CDS Views for Global Trade Management | SAP Help Portal

 

‚òòÔ∏è Claims, Returns, and Refund Management

I‚Äôve explored into Process Navigator - SAP for Me  into SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and the Customer Returns (BKP) process receives important updates in S/4Hana 2025.

üôå  Determine No Refund for Logistical Follow-Up Activity Receive into Plant

You have the option not to refund the customer when you select the logistical follow-up activity Receive into Plant (0001) in the returns order and later on  you can still create a credit memo request or a delivery free-of-charge with reference to the relevant returns order item.

üôå Automatic Inspection After Goods Receipt in Customer Returns

You can enter the inspection result when you create a returns order, before the product is returned. If you already know the inspection result before you receive the product and don‚Äôt want to go through another inspection after it has been returned, you can ask the system to automatically create and complete the inspection using the inspection data and the next follow-up activity you provide when you create the returns order. As a result, after you receive the product, the system completes the inspection and triggers the specified subsequent logistic steps automatically.

üôåRefurbishment Using Maintenance Order as Follow-Up Activity

A maintenance order is created for returned products to initiate the refurbishment process. The maintenance order is configured as a refurbishment order.

üôåRefurbishment Using Production Order as Follow-Up Activity

A production order is created for returned products to initiate the refurbishment process. The production version specified for the production order must be a specific version that indicates refurbishment.

üôåQuality Notification as a Follow-Up Document

When saving a returns order, you can create a quality notification in quality management to trigger a parallel quality management process. The necessary settings for output management using output determination (SD-BF-OC) to create the quality notifications are already maintained.

üôåValuation with Reference to Preceding Sales Process

Traditionally, return deliveries are valuated based on current material valuation.
Now, S/4HANA 2025 allows you to reuse the valuation of the original outbound delivery, which is critical when:

üëâSales context changed over time

üëâHistorical valuation is required

üëâMargin or profitability analysis must stay accurate

This is enabled via a customizing switch and applied at the document level.

üìåNote: The checkbox into the Customer Return item level is currently not available in Fiori apps like Manage Customer Returns or Version 2.  It is accessible through the Create Sales Document transaction in SAP GUI, but don‚Äôt worry is planned to include into ‚ÄúManage Customer Returns Version2‚Äù in the future.

üí°Business Value: It streamlines the return process, resulting in better customer service, while also completing the product's journey internally or forwarding them to the supplier if necessary.

 

‚òòÔ∏è Joule: AI-Driven Sales Insights

SAP continues expanding Joule‚Äôs embedded AI capabilities. For Sales, new features include:

üëâFaster insights into the order fulfillment cycle

üëâAssistance with delivery and supply issue resolution

üëâGuided billing document creation

üëâSupport to streamline the solution quotation process

üí°Business Value: These capabilities help both sales and customer service teams act faster and with more context.

For Joule capabilities in detail, you can visit: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal

üéØFinal Thoughts

SAP S/4HANA 2025 brings meaningful advancements to the Sales line of business by strengthening output flexibility, enhancing extensibility through RAP-based APIs, improving efficiency in order creation, and providing smarter returns process.
Combined with Joule‚Äôs growing AI insights, organizations gain more automation, transparency, and decision support than ever before.

 

I hope this was helpful for you üòä

I'm looking forward to your feedback and thoughts. You can post your questions in the SAP community, referring to this blog post.

Thank you,

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG team.

entry.title: KW407: No prices could be determined for Activity Type SV01 in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition)
entry.content:

‚ÄúNo prices could be determined for object Activity type A000/10301101/SV01
(price indicator 3, value type 1).‚Äù

System details:
- Controlling Area: A000
- Cost Center: 10301101
- Activity Type: SV01
- Cost Center Category: C (Professional Service)

What has been done:
- KP26 is not available (Public Cloud)
- Planned costs uploaded via Import Financial Plan Data (Cost Center Planning)
- Planned activity quantities uploaded via Service Planning
- Planning Category = PLN
- Fiscal year matches costing year
- Valuation variant uses planned activity prices

Pricing context:
- Service pricing currently uses Fixed Amount (DRV1)

Despite the above, costing still fails with KW407.

My questions:

  1. Are there any additional prerequisites for activity price determination in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  2. Are there known restrictions where planned activity prices are not read during costing?

Any guidance or references would be appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: BMH - 'Create Stock Transport' button with retail sites
entry.content:
Dear @MorganeleaB,

In Public Cloud for Retail a site is essentially the retail term for plant/location: Plant, Location = Site, so the way to make it work with sites is ensure your sites have the required plant + BP assignments that the app checks

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-retail/maintaining-sites-for-retail-3i3-

The Create Stock Transport Order button in Transfer Stock Cross Plant (F1957) is plant-based and SAP explicitly checks plant prerequisites customer/supplier assignment for the issuing plant and a default purchasing organization for the receiving plant

Summary:

If in your tenant/setup the Retail site is not represented as a plant usable in those SSCUIs or you‚Äôre prevented from maintaining the plant shipping/purchasing-org assignments then F1957 one-click STO won‚Äôt activate because it‚Äôs explicitly checking plant-based prerequisites like you saw in SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2891646

In that case the standard workaround is to create the STO (UB) via the purchasing apps instead of one-click in F1957. The BMH process itself is simply STO type UB between issuing/receiving plants

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/experiencing-supply-chain-business-scenarios-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition/exploring-the-stock-transfer-without-delivery-bmh-scenario

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Hide / Show dimensions on Tables and Charts in SAC in view / present mode
entry.content:
Hello @Raghav_S 

First and foremost - I absolutely apologize for such a late answer (was extremely busy during Q4/2025 and barely had a time for contribution in community blogs).

To your question. If you would like to have empty table initially (with no dimensions), first you would need to manually remove all dimensions rows in your table's structure on a design time. 

Then, you would need to modify initialization script, depicted in Step3, so that all elements (i.e. dimensions) in drop-down widget are populated as though they are all invisible from the beginning, in other words all they should have suffix (HIDDEN) in their name.

Since your table/chart won't have any dimension defined, you would need to populate them not from the table/chart, but manually.

Script in Step3 should look like below:

// reset global dimensions collections
while (actualDimensionIdTable.length) { actualDimensionIdTable.pop(); }  // dimensions id
while (actualDimensionDescTable.length) { actualDimensionDescTable.pop(); }  // dimensions description

// Manually populate Dimensions
var tableDimensionList = [
	"SALES_ORG", 
	"SALES_ORG_ID", 
	"PARTNER_ID", 
	"DELIVERY_STATUS"
];
// Manually populate Dimensions Description
var modelDimensionDescList = [
	"Sales Org (HIDDEN)",
	"Sales Org Id (HIDDEN)",
	"Partner Id (HIDDEN)",
	"Delivery Status (HIDDEN)"
];

// Create collections
for (i = 0; i < tableDimensionList.length; i++) {
	actualDimensionIdTable.push(tableDimensionList[i]);
	actualDimensionDescTable.push(modelDimensionDescList[i]);
}

// Populate Show/Hide dropdown list
for (var i = 0; i < actualDimensionIdTable.length; i++) {
	dropdownDimensionTable.addItem (
		actualDimensionDescTable[i]
	);
}

Note, all dimensions and their description above have to be named exactly how they are defined in your model.

Hope this helps out.

Best regards,

Slavek Kapitanec

entry.title: 2H2025 - SFCMP-31209 - Advanced Filters on Worksheets - "Unable to load data" error
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

We are experiencing an issue with the new Advanced Filters on Worksheets functionality. A Second Manager has created more than 35 filters on a worksheet. As a result, the list of filters and the Manage button are no longer available, and the user receives the following error message:
"Unable to load data. Check your internet connection."

According to the SAP Implementation Guide "You can have up to 30 criteria per filter spread across one or multiple conditions." 
But this limitation refers to the number of criteria per filter, not the total number of filters.

I've reproduced this issue in our Preview instance. It appears that the system response time increases as more filters are created, and when the number exceeds 35, the system fails to load the filters, resulting in the error above.

For Executive Review, filter data is stored in Metadata Framework (MDF) objects, and filters can be deleted via Manage Data > CompFilterDefinition by entering the filter ID. However, MDF export doesn't contain worksheet advanced filters, they are not stored in CompFilterDefinition, so we are unable to delete or manage them through MDF.

Question:

  • Where are worksheet advanced filter definitions stored, and is there a way to manage or delete them outside of the user interface?

Any guidance or experience with this scenario would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks, Antanina

entry.title: Re: API_PURCHASEORDER ‚Äì ‚ÄúDocument contains no items‚Äù when...
entry.content:
Dear @dwix57,

That error is misleading in this case. With API_PURCHASEORDER_2 (OData V4) in Public Cloud SAP currently supports only:

  • PO type NB (Standard) and
  • customer PO types copied from NB (typically ZNB) with all dependent customizing

If you send another document type like NBF2 and even SAP-delivered variants like NB2/NBF2 the API can end up returning 06/010 Document contains no items although your JSON clearly contains items

SAPs Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3698875

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3555741

Proposal:

If you truly want a supplier Returns PO not an STO:

  • Use PurchaseOrderType = NB or a ZNB by copy of NB
  • Keep IsReturnsItem = true on the item
  • Do not send SupplyingPlant that‚Äôs STO semantics and often indicates you‚Äôre trying to do a plant-to-plant process

Example:

{

  "PurchaseOrderType": "NB",

  "Supplier": "110001",

  "CompanyCode": "BMII",

  "PurchasingOrganization": "MGPO",

  "PurchasingGroup": "001",

  "DocumentCurrency": "PHP",

  "_PurchaseOrderItem": [

    {

      "Material": "10",

      "Plant": "02BP",

      "OrderQuantity": 5,

      "PurchaseOrderQuantityUnit": "PAC",

      "IsReturnsItem": true,

      "NetPriceAmount": 1,

      "NetPriceQuantity": 1,

      "OrderPriceUnit": "PAC"

    }

  ]

}

If you must differentiate returns POs by document type for downstream logic then create a custom PO type copied from NB (ZNB*) and use that in the API

Because you‚Äôre using SupplyingPlant, this looks like an STO-style process even if your business labels it PO with supplier. The Purchase Order API is known to be restricted to NB/copies and historically not suitable for STO scenarios

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3110493

In Public Cloud, SAP provides a separate Stock Transport Order OData V4 API

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/bb9f1469daf04bd894ab2167f8132a1a/807b2c79e22c4ef7a4c30c928bb3344e.html

So if the real intent is store plant ->warehouse plant stock transfer, you should switch to that STO API rather than forcing it through API_PURCHASEORDER_2

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: How can I allow a communication user to schedule a background job?
entry.content:
In BTP ABAP Environment, I have a communication user that needs to schedule a background job while it is handling an inbound call to a custom OData V4 API service. The scheduling fails because the communication user is not authorized to schedule the particular background job. It's failing at an authorization check of the communication user on S_START with:

  • AUTHPGMID = R3TR
  • AUTHOBJTYP = SAJC
  • AUTHOBJNAM = The application job catalog

It's not possible to add S_START to the communication scenario that is used to access the service. How can I give the communication user the authorization to schedule the job?

entry.title: Re: SAP Certified - SAP Generative AI Developer (C_AIG_New Format)
entry.content:
Hi all, first of all ‚Äì thanks so much for learning with SAP and engaging in the SAP Community.

As rightfully said through our support channels, the detailed score report is not available yet and no exact timeline can be communicated at this point. However, you will soon be able to see your own score compared to the cut score. Finally, for the Generative AI Developer exam, the cut score is currently still at 100% which makes it much harder to pass. This was the case for all the pilots published last November. We've already reviewed the exam with independent experts and will implement a lower cut score soon. 

BTW: We verify the task completion via API, which is why it's such a fast response :).

I hope this helps.

entry.title: Decommissioning solution manager
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are in the process for migrating our sap system to S/4Hana public could . The project has already started .

Currently the solution manager 7.2  on our landscape is running on windows server and  with Oracle 12 C database . The database is already out of support .

We are not using any of the solution manager functionalities . And hence would like to decommission this solution manager system.

Could you please confirm if there is any issue or requirement from SAP to have it running ?

Given that the new S/4 HANA implementation is already in progress.

Thanks.

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Decommissioning solution manager
entry.content:
Hi Customer,

There is no mandatory SAP requirement to keep SAP Solution Manager 7.2 running for an SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition implementation.

For S/4HANA Cloud (public), SAP‚Äôs recommended lifecycle management tool is SAP Cloud ALM. Solution Manager is not required to operate or support S/4HANA Cloud systems.

If Solution Manager is not being used (e.g. ChaRM, Test Management, Monitoring, Maintenance Planner) and there are no remaining dependencies from ECC or other SAP systems, it can be safely decommissioned.

Before decommissioning, please ensure:

  • No active SAP systems depend on Solution Manager

  • Any required historical data (audit/compliance) is archived or exported

Given that ECC systems will be decommissioned after the project, there is no SAP-mandated need to keep Solution Manager running.

If I can be of any further assistance to you regarding your query, please return this case to me for further analysis or else kindly confirm this case at your convenience.

if you‚Äôre satisfied with the support received, I would appreciate it if you could take a moment to complete the short survey that will be sent after the case is closed. This survey specifically reflects your interaction with me and the support I provided. Your feedback is valuable to both SAP and myself, and it helps us improve our service.

Thank you again for your time and collaboration.

Kind Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private - What's New in Q1 2026
entry.content:
Happy 2026 SAP Universe!

Welcome to a new year. We‚Äôre excited to kick things off with the upcoming SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2025 FPS01 release, arriving this February. This update brings a rich set of new features and enhancements across the SAP Cloud ERP suite‚Äîfurthering our commitment to helping you run your business with more efficiency, intelligence, and compliance.

As with every new release, there is a wealth of fresh information, documentation, and enablement resources to explore. The good news? The release navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private is already in the process of updating all content to reflect the 2025 FPS01 release. This update will be fully completed during the week of February 27th, and no action is required on your part. SAP will handle everything for you.

 

Access the release navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private

 

Tool Overview

The release navigator for SAP Cloud ERP Private, delivered through SAP Enterprise Support, is an essential resource for end users and administrators alike. It simplifies how you explore and manage new release content by providing:

  • Curated access to relevant documentation and tools
  • Guided insights tailored to your functional needs
  • Enablement opportunities, including webinars, workshops, and training, designed to help you make the most of each release

Whether you're responsible for system administration or simply want to understand what‚Äôs new, the release navigator is your one-stop destination for staying informed.

 

Content Insights

To help you quickly find what matters most, here‚Äôs a snapshot of the new and continuously updated content aligned with the 2025 FPS01 release. If you have suggestions for future topics, we‚Äôd love to hear from you in the comments.

 

New Content

Webinar Series page
We‚Äôre pleased to introduce a new dedicated page within the release navigator that highlights all upcoming and past SAP‚Äëhosted webinars. This centralized resource makes it easier than ever to find the most relevant content for your targeted release.
 
Access the Webinar Series page

  2. Finance
  3. Manufacturing
  4. R&D/Engineering

  6. Service
  7. Sourcing & Procurement

Continuously Updated Content

Retired Content

Blog Topics in SAP Community

Innovation Schedule

To provide a smooth and predictable experience, the release navigator introduces major usability updates once a year in October, along with refreshed content for supported releases. As a reminder, the upcoming updates will roll out automatically over the next few weeks‚Äîno action required.
 

 

Connect with Us

Your feedback is essential to shaping future improvements to the release navigator. We invite you to:
  • Complete our feedback survey
  • Share ideas or requests in the comments section
  • Learn more about the Readiness@Scale team
  • Explore additional content

Thank you for your continued engagement and support.

Best Run,
Readiness@Scale

SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: Re: C4C Workflow Calculation for opportunities not working
entry.content:
Hi colleague,

You can also approach it in the following way. If what you need is to know the number of days spent in a phase, you can handle this in the date definitions: as long as a date is greater than the Sales Phase Start Date, the incremental value is maintained, as shown in Image A.

Then, at the action level, you can define an incremental counter, as illustrated in Image B. After that, you can create another rule to reset the date field to blank, so the condition of the first rule is no longer met and the incremental calculation stops.

AB

I hope this helps.
Best regards.

Fernando DJ Espitia.

entry.title: Dimension is not populating in POP UP
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud ‚Äì Analytics Designer. 

Requirement 

I created a Popup with a CheckboxGroup to select City (dimension) values. 
On clicking Save, the selected cities should filter a table. 

Popup Script 

var selectedCities = CheckboxGroup_2.getSelectedKeys(); 
 
if (selectedCities.length === 0) { 
   Utils.setCityFilter([]); 
} else { 
   Utils.setCityFilter(selectedCities); 
} 
 
Popup_1.close(); 
 

Utility Function 

export function setCityFilter(cities: string[]): void { 
   var ds = Table_2.getDataSource(); 
   ds.setDimensionFilter("City", cities); 
} 

 
ONINITIALIZATION: 

    var ds = Table_2.getDataSource(); 

  

    // Get City members (SAC syntax) 

    var members = ds.getMembers("City"); 

  

    for (var j = 0; j < members.length; j++) { 

  

        CheckboxGroup_2.addItem( 

            members[j].id, 

            members[j].description 

        ); 

  

        ALL_CITIES.push(members[j].id); 

    } 

  

    // Select all by default 

    CheckboxGroup_2.setSelectedKeys(ALL_CITIES); 

     

  

CheckboxGroup_2.addItem(members[j].id ,members[j].description); 

POPUP_1 Code: 

var selectedCities = CheckboxGroup_2.getSelectedKeys(); 

  

if (selectedCities.length === 0) { 

    Utils.setCityFilter([]); 

} else { 

    Utils.setCityFilter(selectedCities); 

} 

Popup_1.close(); 

 

 

 

Issue 

  • Checkbox values are selected correctly 
  • Script is executed 
  • But the table does not update 
  • City dimension is already present in the Filters panel (City ‚Äì All) 

Question 

  1. Why does setDimensionFilter() not work when the dimension is already in the Filters panel? 
  1. What is the correct way to apply a dimension filter via popup checkbox in this case? 
  1. Should ds.getFilters().setDimensionFilter() be used instead? 

Any guidance or best practice would be appreciated. 

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Change in Sales Order after receiving supplier invoice
entry.content:
Once actual COGS is known after PO creation and supplier invoicing, is there any standard automation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition that updates sales order pricing or conditions to recalculate margin at the sales order level?

If not, are post-invoice cost changes expected to be handled outside the sales order through financial postings and reporting only?

Also, while non-financial fields (for example PO number or texts) can be changed after billing, is it supported or recommended to manually adjust sales order line item pricing or quantities to reflect updated COGS and margin?

entry.title: SAP Macros Table - Get Selected Table Row Data
entry.content:
Hello. I am trying to retrieve the data from a table row of my SAP Macros table(sap.fe.macros.Table). Application is running a odata V4 using the Flexible Programming Model. I was able to read some SAP documentation on the getObject() function. When I use this, it seems to only retrieve the data from visible columns, but not hidden ones. Is that by design? Or is there another way I can retrieve everything from the row? 

For Example:

Columns A-D are visible in my application, and oSelectedData = {1, 2, 3, 4}. So only the visible columns. Columns E-H are hidden, and the values are not returned. I was expecting to have {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8}. 

ABCDEFGH
12345678
//Grab Table object
const oTable = this.byId("Table");

//Get selected contexts
const oSelectedContexts = oTable.getSelectedContexts();
const oContext = oSelectedContexts[0];

//Get table row data 
const oSelectedData = oSelectedContexts[0].getObject();

entry.title: Re: How do we trigger a Success Alert.
entry.content: For success scenarios, the cleanest approach is usually to trigger the alert at the end of the main iFlow rather than forcing an exception. If you can add a final step before the End Message, you can call your generic email iFlow via Process Direct there, as long as it‚Äôs in the same tenant. It‚Äôs not as obvious as error handling, but it avoids artificial failures. I document patterns like this in Phonexa so I don‚Äôt have to rethink them every time a similar integration comes up.

entry.title: Re: Transportation Management - Shipping Container and Eq...
entry.content: The container detail can be found in /SCMTMS/D_TORITE-PLATENUMBER.  The field ITEM_CAT in this table denotes what is Product (PRD) and Container (TUR). Since single table has all information it may be needed to split them by ITEM_CAT and join differently to have all values in a single row.  Closing his topic and thank you all.

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud ‚Äì Extensibility for Supplier Rebates (2R7) Business Volume Selection Criteria
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I‚Äôm working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (scope item 2R7 ‚Äì Supplier Rebates / Condition Contracts) and need guidance on extensibility options for Business Volume Selection Criteria.

Requirement

  1. Our customer wants to drive rebate eligibility/rates based on a field that exists in Product (Material) Master as a custom field (created via in-app extensibility).
  2. Conceptually, they want this field available for:
    1. Business Volume Selection Criteria (field / field combination), so the agreement can filter volumes based on that attribute (in addition to standard fields like supplier/material/material group, etc.) Material Group is already in use for another filter.

Questions

  1. In Public Cloud, is it possible to extend Business Volume Selection Criteria (add new fields or new field combinations) for supplier rebates / condition contracts?
  2. If the answer is ‚Äúnot directly‚Äù, is there any supported way to implement custom logic to read Product Master custom fields during business volume determination?
  3. For example via BAdI, enhancement spot, or another officially supported extensibility option that can influence the business volume selection/determination.
  4. If there is no supported extension for this, what is the recommended standard approach (mapping the attribute to an available standard field like product hierarchy/material group, or restructuring master data/pricing logic) while staying within clean-core principles?

Thanks,

Ezequiel

entry.title: C_IEE2E vs. TS410: Is this the new standard for S/4HANA or a legacy "Business Suite" exam?
entry.content:
I am planning to specialize in SAP S/4HANA and am currently looking at the C_IEE2E certification (SAP Certified: Implementation Consultant - End-to-End Business Processes).

I am confused by the terminology and want to ensure I don't study for an outdated version:

  1. The description I received references "SAP Business Suite," which usually implies the legacy ECC environment.

  2. However, I see online that C_IEE2E is intended to replace the TS410 (Integrated Business Processes in S/4HANA) certification.

My Question: Has anyone taken the C_IEE2E recently? Is this strictly for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and is it now the preferred entry-level certification over the retiring TS410?

I want to ensure my certification path is aligned with the latest S/4HANA innovations, not legacy processes.

Thanks for the guidance!

entry.title: Customer Objects Deep Dive in RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard
entry.content:
Gain deeper insights into your customer objects

We are more than happy to announce that we have recently released the Customer Objects deep dive dashboard, a powerful new addition to the RISE with SAP Methodology dashboard that significantly enhances the extensibility-related KPIs displayed in the System View.

The Customer Objects deep dive dashboard provides detailed information about customer objects in eligible systems and empowers customers to analyze the clean core compliance of these objects in more depth and with more clarity.

It can be used both as a standalone analytical tool accessible through the RISE with SAP Methodology tab on the SAP Cloud ALM launchpad and as an integrated component of the System View within the RISE with SAP Methodology dashboard. When accessed through the System View, the data is automatically filtered for the specific system and selected clean core level, providing a seamless analytical experience. The data is based on the most recent ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC) check result that was imported for the selected system into the System View dashboard.

How ABAP Test Cockpit supports clean core level concept

 

The dashboard provides table views for both customer objects and their referenced SAP objects, thus offering comprehensive visibility into the relationship between custom code and (standard) SAP functionality.

The Customer Objects table view includes details about a customer object, such as:

  • Development Package assignment
  • Object Name and Type
  • Clean Core Level
  • Technical Debt Score
  • Number of findings per clean core level (B,C,D)
Customer Objects table view

 

Clicking on an entry in the list of customer objects allows you to drill deeper and display details about the SAP objects that are referenced by the selected customer object.

This view provides details such as

  • Metadata
  • Technical Debt Share, i.e. the extent to which a customer object contributes to the overall technical debt score of the selected system
  • Distribution of findings and their categories (Reference-based, Behavior-based)
  • Classification of the referenced SAP object (Classic API, Internal SAP object, Not recommended SAP object)

Referenced SAP Objects table view

 

Call to Action

RISE customers should begin exploring the Customer Objects dashboard immediately to gain insights into their current extensibility landscape and develop strategies for maintaining clean core compliance throughout their transformation journey.

 

Additional Resources:

Customer Objects | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: SAP ASE Internals
entry.content:
Wow, really nice.

Unfortunately, I think some things are out of date now.  For example, in Sybase ASE Architecture Foundation, it says:

"All resources are located in a single Shared Memory Segment, allocated, and usually locked ‚Ä¢ which is shared by the Engines (Unix Processes)"

Is describing the old "process mode" for the ASE kernel.  The new "threaded mode" uses native OS threads.  Internally ASE creates "engines" which are really just thread queues mimicking the old process based engines.   Threaded mode makes output from monitoring tools like sp_sysmon weird because none of the "engines" (thread queues) are ever waiting for I/O (a ASE "process" (really a thread) goes idle waiting for I/O, but sp_sysmon doesn't show that)

I'm not sure where to look to see how much of the time a user process was waiting for I/O to complete

entry.title: Re: Pre-configured sorting order for Child entity in RAP
entry.content:
@AbhijeetT 

To use presentation variant for a child entity in the object page, it is necessary to annotate @UI.facet with the correct type in the root entity: #PRESENTATIONVARIANT_REFERENCE instead of #LINEITEM_REFERENCE.

https://github.com/SAP-samples/abap-platform-fiori-feature-showcase/blob/main/06_object_page_content.md#presentation-variant---object-page

Cost Centers - Actuals  || SAP_FIN_BC_OH_REP_CCA_PC

For example, for Cost Center Owner DIGITS - Plant Construction D, where a user X is the Cost Center Owner....Can I setup a Business Role for that person where they can only see their Cost Center data when they run those 3 apps?

regards

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Create Custom Role for cost center apps
entry.content:
Dear Sender,

Hope you are doing well!

From IAM perspective it is possible:

You can follow the steps in the link below to create a business role and add the related business catalogs: 

How to Create a New Business Role | SAP Help Portal 

Then you can deactivate other unwanted apps inside:

How to Activate or Deactivate IAM Apps of Type App Authorization Variant | SAP Help Portal 

Then you can set the restrictions in the role about the cost center:

How to Define Authorizations Based on Restrictions | SAP Help Portal

If you have specific authorization issue for the 3 apps, please kindly create a ticket to CO-FIO-OM-IS

Hope this clarified to you!

entry.title: Guidance Needed ‚Äì Repartitioning HANA Table /BIC/FZIM_C12
entry.content:
We would like your guidance regarding repartitioning one of our large tables in SAP CAR on PERSON_NAME. The table /BIC/FZ***  is currently split into 4 partitions, and we are seeing that partition ID 4 contains approximately 1.7 billion records and is rapidly approaching the 2 billion record limit in PERSON_NAME. Due to this, we are considering repartitioning the table, however we are not sure what the correct partitioning strategy should be.

At present, the table is partitioned using two layers: Round-Robin as the first layer and Range partitioning as the second layer based on the column KEY_*** (ranges 0,1,2). The data distribution appears to be highly skewed, with most records in partition 4 and significantly fewer in the other partitions (partition 1 being the smallest), so we are unsure whether the partitioning was originally done correctly and whether this strategy is appropriate for this table going forward.

We have reviewed SAP Notes such as DIGITS (BW-related) and DIGITS (general PERSON_NAME partitioning recommendations), and we are looking for a recommendation similar to the table-specific guidance mentioned in Question 27 of SAP Note DIGITS where the partition method and column are clearly defined for specific tables.

Could you please advise whether there are any table-specific recommendations for how /BIC/FZ***  should be partitioned, and what partition method and key column(s) would be best to avoid future growth issues?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Guidance Needed ‚Äì Repartitioning HANA Table /BIC/FZIM...
entry.content:
For the issue that table is reaching to 2 billion limited, and this can be handled from HANA DB side.

You could review this note below and perform a reorg for the large table as mentioned in note:

2019973 - Handling Very Large Data Volumes in SAP BW on SAP HANA
2374652 - Handling Very Large Data Volumes in SAP BW/4HANA

-> Handling Large Data Volumes - 2 Billion Limit Value Reached

As a remind that you need apply file TABLE_PLACEMENT.zip before the reorg as mentioned in this note.

entry.title: Re: SAP ASE Internals
entry.content:
> Wow, really nice.

Thank you.

> I think some things are out of date now

The document was published 13 years ago, yes, but the information is not out of date.

> ... describing the old "process mode" ...

  1. The document is structured and incremental, one needs to understand the Process Kernel first,  in order to properly understand the Threaded Kernel.  You need to read past page 1.  
  2. The applicable ASE version is stated at the bottom right of each page
  3. Go to page 8 for the Threaded Kernel.

Your further comments are about ASE, not the subject document.

> Internally ASE creates "engines" which are really just thread queues mimicking the old process based engines.

No. 

  • In both modes, ASE uses o/s Threads, but do not let that confuse you
  • In Threaded mod, ASE runs as a single (unix) process,
    • with the Threads exposed and named properly such that you can monitor them
  • In Process Mode, ASE does not "use threads to mimic engines",
    • ASE runs one (unix) process per Engine
    • with the o/s threads quite internal (for a simplified understanding only, you can conceptualise that as one o/s thread per Engine, but it is a different Mode, it is not running in Threaded Mode and mimicking Engines).

> Threaded mode makes output from monitoring tools like sp_sysmon weird because none of the "engines" (thread queues) are ever waiting for I/O (a ASE "process" (really a thread) goes idle waiting for I/O, 

Much confusion.

  • In Threaded Mode, ASE does not have Engines, it has Engine Threads and I/O Threads. 
  • Yes, Engine Threads never wait for an I/O, that is by design. 
    • I/O Threads wait for I/O to complete
    • Do not look for I/O issues in Engine Threads, or Engine issues in I/O Threads
  • an ASE "process" is an internal concept, a spid, it is not an o/s thread or ASE Thread,  It is properly named Task in my document. 
    • Do not confuse ASE Threads or o/s threads with ASE internal Tasks, they have northing to do with each other, there is no equivalence
  • an ASE Task (spid) does not "go idle" while waiting for I/O to complete, it goes "waiting for I/O to complete" (sp_who = "sleeping")
  • an ASE Task (spid) "goes idle" when it has not sent a batch to ASE, when it is not waiting for anything from ASE, ie. ASE is waiting to receive a batch from the Task (sp_who = "recv sleep")
  • In my document page 9, see if you can differentiate:
    • ASE = single unix process, dark grey 3D square
    • ASE Engine Thread Pool = blue 3D squares
    • ASE I/O Thread Pool = blue 3D squares
    • ASE internal Task (spid)
      • Run Queue = blue 3D spheres
      • Sleep Queue = red 3D spheres

> but sp_sysmon doesn't show that)

Sysmon does show that, in the I/O Thread Pool (syb_system_pool) metrics, not in the Engine Thread Pool (syb_default_pool) metrics.  I have no problem at all reading and understanding sysmon metrics, but one needs to examine the overall metrics, over time, and aggregate and display the metrics in a meaningful way (see below).

Sysmon provides ASE (server level) metrics, not Task level metrics.

Cheers
Derek

entry.title: Re: Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development

" The new ABAP Cloud Extension for VS Code delivers a streamlined, file-based development experience with built-in AI assistance. It is powered by an ABAP language server, initially supporting Fiori UI Service development and expanding to additional ABAP Cloud scenarios over time.
This move brings ABAP development into the same environment where developers already build with UI5 and CAP, enabling a unified, AI-enhanced experience across SAP technologies. Eclipse for ABAP will remain our flagship IDE for full-fledged ABAP development. "
